body: Versioning does apply, and the files that will be reverted are listed in the "locally changed items" line before pressing revert. I'll give you that there could be a confirmation though... That said, if the problem is the expectation on what the button does I don't see a "Really revert?" dialog making much difference.

This discussion happened on the forum not too long ago, with a general agreement that a confirmation would be good. Just a single word (revert/override) and a the red color apparently isn't able to convey the consequences appropriately. I actually intended to take a stab at a short message based on your proposal, but never got around to it:

> I agree on the confirmation (though it needs to be much shorter and to the point, I think, maybe something like “Warning: the folder contents on OTHER devices will be overwritten to become identical with THIS device. Files not present here will be deleted on other devices.”?). 

https://forum.syncthing.net/t/do-not-click-override-changes/16081/6

rename.from: 'Revert local changes?' on a receive-only folder should list affected files and seek confirmation before reverting and/or deleting
rename.to: Ask for confirmation before reverting/overriding a folder

body:
I see now that I overlooked the 'Locally changed items' line and expected to see the dialogue it would have shown me when I pressed 'Revert local changes?'  IMO, any confirmation dialogue should somehow draw the user's attention to the list of locally changed items as well as soliciting an additional button press.

Also, I am surprised to learn that a versioning strategy would have protected me.  [The manual](https://docs.syncthing.net/users/versioning.html) strongly suggests otherwise.

> Also, I am surprised to learn that a versioning strategy would have protected me. [The manual](https://docs.syncthing.net/users/versioning.html) strongly suggests otherwise.

What are you referring to? Maybe

> Versioning applies to changes received from other devices.

Reverting files is receiving changes from other devices, but I can see how that might not be obvious. Feel free to propose changes to the docs to make it more clear.

> Versioning applies to changes received *from other devices*.

Yes, that's the line that suggests to me file versioning does not apply here.  It also happens to be the first line of an 'important note' box and the words 'from other devices' are italicised to provide additional emphasis.

> Reverting files is receiving changes from other devices, but I can see how that might not be obvious.

Yes, not obvious at all.  Without an in-depth understanding of the versioning machinery I can't be certain this is correct, but how about the following?

>Versioning applies to changes received *from other devices*, with one notable exception; locally introduced changes to receive-only folders are versioned when the changes are manually reverted using the UI.

> > I agree on the confirmation (though it needs to be much shorter and to the point, I think, maybe something like “Warning: the folder contents on OTHER devices will be overwritten to become identical with THIS device. Files not present here will be deleted on other devices.”?).

How about moving the "Revert Local Changes" button to the "Locally Changed Items" dialog?  Just a quick idea, I'm not even sure whether such a dialog pops up or what it looks like.  But that would couple the "what will happen" preview directly to the opportunity of pressing the red button.

> How about moving the "Revert Local Changes" button to the "Locally Changed Items" dialog?

Good idea.  That would have prevented me from losing my work.

> that would couple the "what will happen" preview directly to the opportunity of pressing the red button.

Yes it would, and coupling the list of changes with the option to revert those changes makes accidental or inadvertant data loss far less likely.

issue.title: gui: Add confirmation dialog for revert/override (fixes #7520)

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

milestone.title: v1.16.0
milestone.description: This release adds untrusted / encrypted devices for public testing. It should still be considered beta / testing-only.

issue.body: Generalises the confirmation dialog for deleting items added to receive-encrypted folders to also handle reverting/overriding receive/send-only folders (fixes #7520).
